moves.1. d4: Another game from my QGD slav exchange tournament. This is one of the few that I was lucky enough to win
moves.4. Nf3: I'm still not sure about this move at this point it seems passive to me, though of course it is a step towards castling
moves.4... Nf6 5. Nc3 Bf5 6. Qb3: As black has moves his lsb I can make some early threats, I am hoping to get my lsb on the a4-e8 diagonal as soon as I can
moves.6... b6: I'm not sure this is the best move for black I think I would probably defend the pawn with my queen, perhaps Qd7
moves.7. Bg5: black is starting to look a little cramped
moves.7... e6: While this opens a nice line for the dsb it also prevent the lsb from defending the king
moves.8. e4: Now I can finally get my lsb to b5
moves.8... dxe4 9. Bb5+ Ke7: I'm not sure I understand this move, the black dsb is looking very sorry for itself now, I was expecting something like Nb8-d7
moves.10. Ne5: My knight is going to be tough to shift from there while the black f6 knight stays where it is though of course it can't currently move
moves.10... Qd6: Looking to free some space for the king, I have the white squares around it dominated, I just need to work out how to claim the black ones too
moves.11. Bf4: Threatens to gain the queen with something like Nc6+
moves.11... Qxd4 12. Rd1: Now Nc6 is even more tempting if it wasn't for the black knight on b8, I considered Bc6 which would gain material but in the end I wanted to trap the black king in, the black queens options are limited now
moves.12... Qc5 13. Na4: And now black is doomed, its hard to see how he can save his queen or the game
moves.15. Nxc5 bxc5 16. Qxc5#: Thanks for reading please feel free to comment
